title: 3 Simple Ways to Make Your Own Carp Bait

steps.title: Mix the dry ingredients.
steps.content: Mix the dry ingredients. Stir together 1 cup (240 ml) of flour and 2 cups (470 ml) of yellow cornmeal in a bowl.

steps.title: Dissolve 3 tbsp.
steps.content: Dissolve 3 tbsp. (45 ml) of strawberry gelatin in 3 cups (710 ml) of boiling water on the stove top. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Stir the dry ingredients into the boiling water.
steps.content: Stir the dry ingredients into the boiling water. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Lower the heat on the stove's burner.
steps.content: Lower the heat on the stove's burner. Cook the carp bait for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.

steps.title: Remove the cooked dough from the heat.
steps.content: Remove the cooked dough from the heat. Allow it to cool.

steps.title: Store the dough in a plastic bag inside the refrigerator.
steps.content: Store the dough in a plastic bag inside the refrigerator. It will keep for 1 to 3 weeks. Don't freeze these carp bait dough balls.

steps.title: Form the dough into balls when you're ready to fish.
steps.content: Form the dough into balls when you're ready to fish.

steps.title: Blend the dry ingredients in a large bowl.
steps.content: Blend the dry ingredients in a large bowl. [3] X Research source Mix 12 ounces (340 g) of yellow cornmeal and 4 ounces (113 g) of brown sugar.

steps.title: Crack 3 large eggs into the dry mixture.
steps.content: Crack 3 large eggs into the dry mixture. Add 2 ounces (60 ml) of cooking oil. Stir until the mixture forms a rigid paste. You may need to adjust the amounts of cornmeal and oil until you reach the proper consistency.

steps.title: Add a few drops of red food coloring to the paste.
steps.content: Add a few drops of red food coloring to the paste.

steps.title: Rub cooking oil onto your hands.
steps.content: Rub cooking oil onto your hands. This will keep the dough from adhering to your skin as you form the bait balls.

steps.title: Roll the dough into balls measuring 1 inch (2.5 cm) in diameter.
steps.content: Roll the dough into balls measuring 1 inch (2.5 cm) in diameter. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Boil the dough balls in water for 2 to 3 minutes on the stove top.
steps.content: Boil the dough balls in water for 2 to 3 minutes on the stove top. The dough balls will bloat significantly during cooking.

steps.title: Use a slotted spoon to raise the dough balls, or boilies, from the water.
steps.content: Use a slotted spoon to raise the dough balls, or boilies, from the water. Drain the boilies on paper towels and let them cool off.

steps.title: Place the boilies on a drying rack.
steps.content: Place the boilies on a drying rack. Allow them to dry for 5 to 6 hours.

steps.title: Store the boilies in plastic bags in the freezer.
steps.content: Store the boilies in plastic bags in the freezer. Thaw before using.

steps.title: Combine the dry ingredients.
steps.content: Combine the dry ingredients. Mix 2 cups (470 ml) of flour, 2 cups (470 ml) of crushed wheat flakes breakfast cereal, 1/4 cup (60 ml) of chopped peanuts, and 8 tbsp. (120 ml) of sugar.

steps.title: Add the moist ingredients.
steps.content: Add the moist ingredients. Blend in 4 tbsp. (60 ml) of margarine and 8 tsp. (40 ml) of molasses.

steps.title: Pour in a cherry-flavored carbonated beverage, adding a little at a time until you have a firm dough.
steps.content: Pour in a cherry-flavored carbonated beverage, adding a little at a time until you have a firm dough. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Mold the dough into balls.
steps.content: Mold the dough into balls.
